results.title: Test pilot
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Baines and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Danger”
Appraises the qualities needed by a test pilot and shows his day to day work, not only in actual flying but also in cooperating with the back-room boys.

results.title: Blue watch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Danger”.
One of the BBC series “Living with Danger” this film deals with the work of the Fire Service in the United Kingdom. The routine training courses and varied duties for full-time and part-time recruits are shown, and the highly disciplined teams of modern fire-fighters are also revealed as family and home-loving men, with spare time activities and individual hobbies. Culminates in a spectacular fire-fighting operation against a quickly spreading factory fire.

results.title: How to read plays
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
The suggestions in this film for reading a play emphasise imaginative reconstruction of the stage production, thus enabling the reader to grasp the visual, aural and dramatic content of a play from the written page.

results.title: How to read essays
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
Such great writers as Lamb, Hunt Addison, Thackeray and Steveson, who produced political and humorous as well as philosophical essays, are portrayed at work in their native surroundings. The film emphasises that for full appreciation an essay should be read with an understanding of the author, their purpose and their style.

results.title: How to read biographies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
Shows how biographies may help in understanding history through the use of recreations from a number of biographies and autobiographies. Insights into the characters and philosophies of famous men and women are also given.

results.title: English lyrics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
The lyrics of Tennyson, Keats, Wordsworth, Shelley, Shakespeare, Browning and others are presented. Viewing such scenes as Dover Beach, Westminser Bridge, and the Shropshire country, students gain new appreciation and understanding of the work of poets.
